Vocabularies.Definition: n. 相识； 熟人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She's an old acquaintance of mine.

Vocabularies.Definition: be very keen on and absorbed in 对… 入了迷
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Many of the leaders have become hooked on power and money.

Vocabularies.Definition: bring into action or existence 使产生，引出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His speech called forth an angry response.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 交流，交际，通信
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There was a lack of communications between us.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a single human being 个人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We designed this software in order to meet the needs of individual users.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. knowing no evil, naive天真无邪的 n. an innocent person
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Jack is still as innocent as a child and is easily taken in.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  serious and concentrated 认真的，紧张的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I have never seen an intense student like him.

Vocabularies.Definition: as you already know or would expect 不用说
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Needless to say, I survived the earthquake.

Vocabularies.Definition: all things considered, in general 总的看来，大体上，基本上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   On the whole, your opinion is right.

Vocabularies.Definition: in addition to 除…之外（还）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   An extra 700 jobs are being cut on top of the 2,000 that were lost last year.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. 向外
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The door opens outwards.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. during or for the night 一整夜，一夜间
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   If you leave your bike here overnight, it's likely to disappear.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a plan or an outline of the events in a play or novel 情节
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The author wove a story from three plots.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. throw in different directions 散布
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The farmers are scattering seeds over the fields.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. 溜（走），悄悄地走
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He slipped out into the garage.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 倾向
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There is a tendency to use plastics in place of metals.

Vocabularies.Definition: as far as one knows personally 据…所知
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   To my knowledge, Jack didn't get the job offer.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  传播媒介；交通工具
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Air is the vehicle of sound.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a particular form or variation of sth. 版本
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I've read the Chinese version of the novel.

Vocabularies.Definition: a., ad.  全世界的；在全世界范围内
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The comet caused a worldwide panic.
